post.description:
This API allows you to top-up into the customer's wallet. Refer to the [Fund wallet user guide](/docs/fund-wallet) for details on usage instructions on this API.
 >ℹ️ INFO 
 >**Guidelines for Fund Wallet.**
>1. Cards and direct_debit funding channels are restricted by default. Reach out to your Nium support specialist to enable this functionality.
>2. Source and destination should be in the same currency when funding channel is bank_transfer, cards, or direct_debit.
>3. No restriction on source or destination currency if funding channel is prefund.

requestBody.description:
Guidelines for Fund Wallet

1.cards as a funding channel is restricted by default. It may be enabled for a client on request.
2.Source and destination currencies should be same if funding channel is bankTransfer or cards
3.No restriction on source or destination currency if funding channel is prefund.

Fund Wallet with a Card

Customer onboarded and KYCed successfully [through Manual or eKYC flow] with e-KYC calls Fund Wallet API with funding channel as cards.

get.description:
This API allows you to fetch virtual accounts assigned to a customer's wallet. 
 ⚠️ WARNING 
 > To access updated functionality and features we recommed using the latest version of this API [Virtual Account Details V2](/apis/reference/virtualaccountdetailsv2). Eventually, this API version will be deprecated and becomes unsupported.

parameters.description: Unique client identifier generated and shared before API handshake.
parameters.name: clientHashId
currencyCode
parameters.description: This field accepts the [3-letter ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for which routing code search is to be initiated.
Unique customer identifier generated and shared before API handshake.
parameters.name: customerHashId
endDate
parameters.description: End date for fetching the transaction details. The format for endDate is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description:
The sort order for the results. Acceptable values are ASC or DESC.
The default order is DESC.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description:
In some cases, the response can return multiple pages of data. Use this parameter to page through the returned results.
The default page is 0.

parameters.name: property
parameters.description: Define how to sort paginated data. The default sorting order is 'createdAt'.

parameters.name: size
parameters.description: Define how many elements get retunred per response page. Accepted values can be 1-20.

parameters.name: startDate
parameters.description: The beginning date to start fetching transaction details. The format for `startDate` is YYYY-MM-DD.

parameters.name: tagKey
parameters.description: Use this parameter to filter responses, based on the exact value of `tagKey`. The `tagkey` can be used also be used as an independent search parameter.

parameters.name: tagValue
parameters.description: Use this parameter to filter responses, based on the exact value of `tagValue` (that may be mapped for a `tagKey` defined against transactions). The `tagValue` can also be used as an independent search parameter.
Unique wallet identifier generated and shared before API handshake.

parameters.description: Enter a unique UUID value
parameters.name: x-request-id

If no currencies are being sent in query param then account ownership certificate will be generated for all the currencies enabled to the customer.

get.description: This API allows you to download an account ownership certificate.

bankName.description: The name of the bank which has issued the account linked to this funding instrument.

clientHashId.description: The unique 36-character client identifier generated and shared before the API handshake.

country.description: The [two-letter ISO-2 country code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) where the bank account resides.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the funding instrument was added.

currency.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the account to be linked.

customerHashId.description: The unique 36-character customer identifier generated and shared before API handshake.

fundingChannel.description: Details how the wallet is configuered to be funding.

maskedAccountNumber.description: The masked bank account number in the format XXXXXXXXXXXX1111.

redirectURL.description: The URL customers are redirected to when they're finsished.

routingType.description: The routing code type, for example, 'ACH CODE' for US.

routingValue.description: The routing code of the account.

saved.description:
• Returns true when the funding instrument is saved.
  • This can return false when funding instrument status is not yet approved.

status.description: The current status of the funding instrument.

updatedAt.description: Tthe timestamp when the funding instrument was last updated.

errors.description: A list a of errors if any occurred.

message.description: Returns additional background information about the error message.

status.description: The `HTTP` status code of the request.

body.description: The response message from our server.

code.description: The `HTTP` status code and additional details about what the code means.

errors.description: Returns a description of the error if any ocurred.

status.description: Details if the request was successful or if an error has ocurred.

otpReceived.description: The one-time password (OTP) you received from Nium when calling the Add Funding Instrument API. This is a required field for EU and UK direct deposits.

accountNumber.description: The customer account number or IBAN.

country.description: The [2-letter ISO-2 country code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) where the bank account resides.

currency.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the linked account.

fundingChannel.description: The mode to use to fund a wallet. Adding a new funding instrument is only supported for direct debit.

routingCodes.description: Accepts the List of routing code type and value.

description.description: A brief description of the wallet.

items.description: Ender details about the quantity and price.

name.description: The name of the account holder.

number.description: A unique alphanumeric value containing an invoice number for your reference at a later time.

unitPrice.description: The price of an indivdual unit. Only accepts whole numbers; decimals and partial integers are not allowed.

unitQuantity.description: This quantity of units. Only accepts whole numbers; decimals and partial integers are not allowed. whole number

country.description: The [2-letter ISO-2 country code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) where the bank account resides.

createdAt.description: The timestamp of when the funding instrument was added.

currency.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the account to be linked.

fundingChannel.description: The mode of funding the wallet. Direct debit is supported when adding a new funding instrument.

fundingInstrumentId.description: The unique 36-character alphanumeric identifier of a funding instrument. The ID is a bank account identifier when the funding channel is direct debit.

returnUrl.description: The URL to redirect the customer when they're done.

status.description:
This field contains the status of the request. Available values include:
  • PENDING
  • FAILED

type.description: This field accepts the routing code type.

value.description: This field accepts the routing code value.

amount.description: The amount in the destination currency to transfer. If `amount` is provided, it will take precedence over the `sourceAmount` field.

countryIpAddress.description: The country IP address of the device the customer is using to initate the request.

destinationCurrencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the destination amount.

fundingChannel.description:
• Funding wallets using PREFUND is available via cross-currency.
  • Funding wallets using BANK_TRANSFER mode is only available for SGD to SGD. BANK_TRANSFER is not available for cross-currency funding.
  • Funding wallets using DIRECT_DEBIT is only available for the USA.

fundingInstrumentExpiry.description: The expiry date of the funding insturment in MMYY format. Required when adding new cards.

fundingInstrumentHolderName.description: Name of the card holder as printed on the card. Maximum length of this field is 26 characters. This is required in case of new card.

fundingInstrumentId.description: The ID of the funding instrument that's returned when Adding a `fundingInstrument` `. The `fundingInstrumentId` is a card hash when `fundingChannel` is **CARD** and required only for existing cards. The id is a bank account identifier when the funding channel is direct debit.

fundingInstrumentNumber.description: The 16-digit card number. Required when adding new cards.

fundingInstrumentSecurityNumber.description: The 3-digit CVV number. Required for both new and existing cards.

invoiceDetails.description: Used only for JPY collection fund requests.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the device the customer is using to initate the request.

pocketName.description: The name of the pocket as defined under base currency.

save.description: Set to **TRUE** to save the funding instrument for future transfers.

sessionId.description: The session ID of the instance the customer is initiating. the request.

sourceAmount.description: The amount in the source currency to convert and transfer. Note the `amount` field takes precedence over `sourceAmount`.

sourceCurrencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the source amount.

statementNarrative.description: Set what to display on bank account statements when they are pulling funds using Direct Debit. The value entered will be truncated to 10 characters for the UK and US, and 140 chars for the EU.

destinationCurrencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the destination amount.

paymentMethods.description:
An array with three types of objects:
  • Bank transfer data
  • Dynamic pay now code
  • Static pay now code

returnUrl.description: A 3DS Stripe URL generated to enter a One-Time Password (OTP).

sourceAmount.description: The amount in the source currency that's being converted and transfered. Note the `amount` field takes precedence over `sourceAmount`.

sourceCurrencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) for the source amount.

status.description:
Returns the following values:
  • Pending: Authorization of the transaction is awaiting approval.
  • Approved: The transaction has been approved and successfully authorized.
  • Rejected: The transaction was rejected due to NIUM's risk and compliance policy.
  • Declined: The transaction was declined. Follow up with the account owner to confirm funds are available, and the details provided are correct.
  • Reversal: The transaction was reversed and refunded.
  • Disputed: The account owner has disputed the transaction and filed a dispute with their bank.
  • DisputeClosed: The dispute filed against the transaction has been resolved.

systemReferenceNumber.description: The transaction reference number generated by the card issuance platform.

bankName.description: The name of the bank that issued the account associated with the funding instrument.

cardBankName.description: The name of the bank that issued the card associated with the funding instrument.

cardNetwork.description: The payment network the provided card uses. At this time we support Visa and MasterCard.

cardType.description: The type of card being used. Available values include **credit** and **debit**.

clientHashId.description: The unique 36-character client identifier generated and shared before the API handshake.

country.description: The country the card or account was originally opened in.

createdAt.description: A timestamp detailing when the funding instrument got added. Retunred in a YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss format.

currency.description: This currency the submitted the card or account uses.

customerHashId.description: The unique 36-character customer identifier generated and shared before the API handshake.

fundingChannel.description: The funding channel of the funding instrument.

maskCardNumber.description: The 16-digit card number in a masked format: 1234-56xx-xxxx-3456.

maskedAccountNumber.description: The account number in a masked format where only the blast 4 digits are visible.

saved.description: Details if the the funding instrument is saved for future funding transfers. or not.

status.description: The status of the funding instrument.

threeDSecureUsage.description: Details if the funding instrument supports 3DS verification.

updatedAt.description: A timestamp detailing when the funding instrument was last updated. Retunred in a YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss format.

walletHashId.description: This field contains the unique 36-character wallet identifier generated and shared before API handshake.

errors.description: Returns the errors that occurred if any.

message.description: Provides more details about the returned error, if any.

status.description: HttpStatus of the request : BAD_REQUEST, INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR.

errors.description: Returns the errors that occurred if any.

message.description: Provides more details about the returned error, if any.

tags.description:
Use this field to create and include tags for your future reference. Accepts client defined key-value pairs.
The maximum number of tags allowed is 15.

accountCategory.description: The category the virtual account was assigned to.

bankName.description: The name of the bank which has issued the account linked to this account.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) of the payment.

customerDetails.description: This object accepts customer details while assigning payment ID. This fields is conditional based on the Clients, who intends to leverage this API to request for VAN allocation without onboarding

bankName.description: The name of the bank which has issued the customer's account linked.

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) used by the customer's account.

uniquePayerId.description: The unique email ID provided to the customer in addition to a `uniquePaymentId` for supported regions and configurations. If the region doesn't support `uniquePayerId`, the field will return null.

tags.description:
Use this field to create and include tags for your future reference. Accepts client defined key-value pairs.
The maximum number of tags allowed is 15.

uniquePaymentId.description: The unique virtual account assigned to the customer.

totalElements.description: Details the total number of items retunred in the response.

totalPages.description: Details the number of pages in the response body.

tags.description:
Use this field to create and include tags for your futre reference. Accepts client defined key-value pairs.
The maximum number of tags allowed is 15.

accountCategory.description: The category the virtual account was assigned to.

accountName.description: The name of the bank account or the primary beneficiary.

accountType.description: Details the type of the virtual account.

bankAddress.description: The address of the bank that holds the virtual account.
bankAddress.example: 1088 Roosevelt Street, San Francisco, United States 94105

bankName.description:
This field represents the bank name of the virtual account Available values include:
* BOL_LT
* MONOOVA_AU
* DBS_HK
* DBS_SG
* JPM_AU
* JPM_SG
* CB_GB
* CFSB_USINTL
* JPM_UK

currencyCode.description: The 3-letter [ISO-4217 currency code](doc:currency-and-country-codes) of the payment.

fullBankName.description: The name of the issuing bank in its entirety.

routingCodeValue1.description: The routing code value 1. See [Examples of Routing Codes](/apis/docs/routing-codes#examples-of-routing-codes) for more details.

routingCodeValue2.description: The routing code value 2. See [Examples of Routing Codes](/apis/docs/routing-codes#examples-of-routing-codes) for more details.

status.description: The current status of the funding instrument.

uniquePayerId.description: This field contains the unique payer ID.

key.description:
Accepts the name of a tag.
The maximum character length for tag keys is 128 characters.

value.description:
Accepts the value of a tag.
The maximum character length for tag values is 256 characters.

action.description:
Set the tag operation of your request. Available values include:
  • DELETE: When you want to remove tags.
  • MAINTAIN: When you want to update, add, or change tags.

key.description:
Accepts the name of a tag.
The maximum character length for tag keys is 128 characters.

value.description:
Accepts the value of a tag.
The maximum character length for tag values is 256 characters.
Note: A value must be included if `tags.action` is **MAINTAIN**.

BankTransfer.description: A "bank transfer" refers to a method of electronic payment that enables you to transfer funds from your bank account to another bank account or from the same bank or to a different financial institution. Bank transfer often get used for larger transactions, such as paying bills or sending money to a friend or family member.

accountName.description: This name of the NIUM bank account.

accountNumber.description: The physical bank account number of NIUM.

bankName.description: The name of the bank money is being transferred to.

iban.description: The International Bank Account Number. Also called an IBAN, is a combination of country code, check digits, bank code, sort code and account number.

sortCode.description: UEN number associated with NIUM PayNow account.

type.description:
The type of payment method. Available values include:
  • staticPayNow
  • dynamicPayNow
  • bankTransfer

BankTransfer.title: Bank transfer

DynamicPayNow.description: The amount to be paid can be adjusted or changed in real-time before the payment is initiated. DynamicPayNow payments are often used for transactions with dynamic pricing like buying shares of a company's stock or making a bid in an auction.

UEN.description: The UEN number associated with NIUM's PayNow account.

type.description: This field contains the type of payment method such as staticPayNow, dynamicPayNow, or bankTransfer.

DynamicPayNow.title: Dynamic pay now code

StaticPayNow.description: The amount to be paid is fixed and cannot be changed once the payment is initiated. StaticPayNow payments are most often used for one-time transactions, such as paying for a product or service.

qrCode.description: Returns the codec-base64 encoded QRCode image data. Once decoded, a QRCode image becomes available. The QRCode image can be read by devices such as smartphone or camera.

type.description: Details the type of payment method used; in this case **staticPayNow**.

StaticPayNow.title: Static pay now code
